slides.title: The Constitution
slides.content:
**Adopted:** 26 November 1949
**Enforced:** 26 January 1950 (Republic Day)

**Features:**
- Longest written constitution
- Federal structure with unitary bias
- Parliamentary form of government
- Fundamental Rights & Duties
- Directive Principles of State Policy

slides.title: Fundamental Rights
slides.content:
**Six Fundamental Rights:**

1. Right to Equality (Articles 14-18)
2. Right to Freedom (Articles 19-22)
3. Right against Exploitation (Articles 23-24)
4. Right to Freedom of Religion (Articles 25-28)
5. Cultural and Educational Rights (Articles 29-30)
6. Right to Constitutional Remedies (Article 32)

Note: Right to Property removed by 44th Amendment

slides.title: Union Executive
slides.content:
**President:**
- Head of State
- Elected by Electoral College
- Term: 5 years
- Executive, Legislative, Judicial powers

**Vice President:**
- Chairman of Rajya Sabha
- Elected by Electoral College
- Term: 5 years

**Prime Minister:**
- Head of Government
- Leader of majority party in Lok Sabha

slides.title: Parliament
slides.content:
**Lok Sabha (House of the People):**
- Maximum: 552 members
- Current: 545 members
- Term: 5 years
- Presided by Speaker

**Rajya Sabha (Council of States):**
- Maximum: 250 members
- Current: 245 members
- Permanent house (1/3 retire every 2 years)
- Presided by Vice President

slides.title: Judiciary
slides.content:
**Supreme Court:**
- Apex court of India
- Chief Justice + 33 judges
- Guardian of Constitution
- Power of Judicial Review

**High Courts:** State level

**District Courts:** District level

**Independence:** Appointments, tenure, removal process ensures independence
